conclusion: To find the coefficient of friction \(\mu\) and the angle \(\theta\), we need to analyze the forces acting on the suitcase.

The total mass of the suitcase is 15 kg, gravitational acceleration is 10 m/sÂ², and the minimum pull force is 90 N.

The weight of the suitcase is 150 N.

conclusion: The pulling force is 90 N, and frictional force is \(f = \mu N\).

premise: Resolve the pulling force into components: Horizontal component: \(F \cos \theta\). Vertical component: \(F \sin \theta\).
conclusion: The horizontal component of the pulling force is \(F \cos \theta\) and the vertical component is \(F \sin \theta\).

premise: In the horizontal direction: \(F \cos \theta = \mu N\). In the vertical direction: \(N + F \sin \theta = W\).
conclusion: The equations of motion are \(F \cos \theta = \mu N\) and \(N + F \sin \theta = W\).

premise: Substitute \(N = W - F \sin \theta\) into the horizontal equation.
